articles.description: Americans's interest in a COVID-19 vaccine is waning, with only 56% of adults saying they would get it if it were available. That's down from 74% in April.
articles.content: Anthony Kong of the Los Angeles Fire Department prepares a dose of COVID-19 vaccine. Just as vaccines are becoming available, fewer Americans are willing to take them, according to a new study. (Gary… [+4605 chars]
